newsitem.title: USA: No appeal of lawyer dismissal in baby death case.
newsitem.headline: No appeal of lawyer dismissal in baby death case.

text.p: The Delaware Supreme Court late on Friday refused to consider an appeal of a lower court's decision dismissing the lawyer of a New Jersey teenager charged with the murder of her newborn son.
Amy Grossberg and her boyfriend Brian Peterson were charged with murdering their infant son last year and leaving the body in a motel dumpster near the University of Delaware.

Last month Judge Henry duPont Ridgely, of the Delaware Superior Court, removed Grossberg's attorney Robert Gottlieb from the case because his "orchestration" of Grossberg's interview with Barbara Walters on ABC's "20/20" show in May allegedly violated a court-imposed gag order.

In papers signed by chief justice Norman Veasey for the three-judge panel that considered the appeal request, the court said "we have no jurisdiction to hear an interlocutory appeal in a criminal case."
The court added that "the action of the trial court of which Mr. Gottlieb complains may be reviewable after the underlying criminal case has come to final judgment."
